question: str.replace为什么会将数字替换成NaN
description:
df = pd.DataFrame({'sales':[100,'$5','5,600',4564]})
df['sales'].str.replace('$','')

为什么会将数字替换成NaN


df['sales'].str.replace('$','')

df['sales'].replace('$','')  区别是啥

answers.lvl1_answer:
df['sales'].str 这个会把非str类型转换成NaN

df['sales'].str.replace('$','') 是对数据操作

df['sales'].replace('$','') 是对列操作
